title: Komodo Wind Shader
description: Komodo Wind Shader is a AAA style wind system that can be applied to any foliage asset material, it supports any foliage asset including ones that use nanite. It also supports noise texture driven wind patterns.
longDescription:
Discord for support: https://discord.com/invite/GXZ7c74sTm

Written Documentation: Google Docs

Video Showcase: Youtube


Komodo Wind Shader allows you to apply global wind to foliage assets in your levels with ease, it supports all foliage assets including custom made and from the marketplace. Trees, grass, card meshes, nanite meshes, flowers, plants, and more are all supported and will be synced to the wind using a material paramater collection, for objects that need their own intensity there is also a localized version of the material function for the wind.


This asset also has the ability to drive wind patterns via a noise texture similar to ghost of tsushima for a unique look to your game. if you do not want a noise texture you can simply use a white image and the wind will not follow a pattern, the asset comes with 5 noise textures you can use.


NOTE: This is a shader/material function, it is not a foliage mesh asset pack. it is meant to compliment your existing foliage assets. Showcase map uses assets from https://www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/en-US/product/ef-grounds


Disclaimer: This Product Supports Nanite for Unreal Engine 5.0+
technicalDetails:
Features:

  •  Drive wind patterns via a noise texture to create unique wind effects in your game like the AAA studios do.
  •  Syncs all wind patterns across all meshes that use this shader with easy global editing via a material parameter collection.
  •  Supports all types of foliage assets. Nanite high poly, low poly, card based, trees, plants, flowers, bushes, if its foliage this asset can make it move with the wind.
  • The wind can change direction, speed, and intensity at runtime across your entire level with just a single node.

Number of Unique Materials and Material Instances: 2 Material Functions for shader, 5 Materials for demo content.

Number of Textures: 5(For noise wind patterns), 30 for demo content meshes.

Texture Resolutions: 1024x1024(Noise Textures only), Ranges from 512x512-8024x8024 for demo content.

Supported Development Platforms: Windows, Mac, Linux

Windows: Yes

Mac: Yes

Documentation: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dQIWzYidAG3KeQkvnYqTFPrEC-2TUrNWFx-GuNZrNsQ/edit?usp=sharing

Important/Additional Notes: Demo Content can be deleted as its just for demo purposes.

releaseInfo.releaseNote: The noise textures were generated in photoshop I have rights to them, and the demo content is from the epic games edith finch pack.
